element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithms add elevation values to a layer with contour lines, based on the information contained in an additional layer with line that represent uphill paths.
For each uphill segment, a starting elevation and an interval value are needed. The algorithm will assign the starting value to the first line crossed by the segment, and the starting value + n times the interval to each n-th line crossed.
This way, labeling of contour lines can be simplified.
The direction of uphill segments should correctly reflect the change in elevation. That is, the first point must represent the lowest point, while the last one should represent the highest point.

element.name: CONTOURS_LAYER_FIELD
element.text: The field in the contour lines layer where elevation values should be set.

element.name: UPHILL_LAYER_FIELD
element.text: The field with the starting height for each uphill line

element.name: UPHILL_LAYER_INTERVAL_FIELD
element.text: The field with the interval value for each uphill line

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The resulting layer contains the same lines as the input contour lines one, but with new elevation values in the selected elevation field. For those lines not crossed by any uphill line, the original value is left.
